# The Data

```{r, fig.width=10, fig.height=6}
library(faraway)
data(corrosion)
help(corrosion)
plot(corrosion)
```

# Simple Linear Model

```{r}
fit = lm(loss ~ Fe, data = corrosion)
summary(fit)
```

Iron prevents corrosion.
For 1.5% of iron we would expect 129.8 - 1.5 * 24.0 weight loss.

```{r}
129.8 - 1.5 * 24
```

\newpage

# Hypothesis testing

We want to test

$$
\psi\left(\beta\right) = c^T\beta
$$

for

$$
c^T = (1, 1.5)
$$

The test statistics is

$$
\frac{\widehat{\psi} - 95}{\widehat{SE}_{\widehat{\psi}}}
$$

```{r}
library(car)
predict(fit, data.frame(Fe = 1.5), interval = 'confidence')
c = c(1, 1.5)
linearHypothesis(fit, c, 95)
```
